title: Dialogue possible after PTI apologizes for May 9: Asif
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 1 (APP):The Federal Minister for Defense, Khawaja Muhammad Asif, said on Monday that for any meaningful dialogue to take place, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaaf (PTI) must seek an unconditional apology for orchestrating the events of May 9.
Talking to a private news channel, he pointing towards Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf, and stated that it was impossible to negotiate with a party engaged in activities that undermine the political process.
He said that the Prime Minister had repeatedly called for discussions and even proposed a Charter of Economy to address the country’s challenges.
The Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) had consistently emphasized the importance of dialogue for the restoration of politics, he added.
When asked about recent talks with the Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam (F) chief and the ongoing reconciliation efforts, Khawaja said that reconciliation has always been an important part of PML-N’s politics.
He acknowledged that Maulana Fazal Ur Rehman, being a seasoned politician, can play a pivotal role in the legislative process.
